Articles.Content:
> 
> I'd like to be a volunteer.

I think if you read Bioman's post again, he was suggesting something similar to KGSS that is not KGSS. That means another thread should be started. This is what Bioman said:

> 
> I think someone should make an inter-company sceince association, like KGSS ...

> 
> Is there going to Be another journal?

We produced 3 journals and it simply didn't get the audience we were hoping which means a fourth journal is unlikely.

> 
> ....
> We produced 3 journals and it simply didn't get the audience we were hoping which means a fourth journal is unlikely.

I believe you're wrong on that. I believe there were enough people reading them. Writing is a completely different matter. Without any suggestions about the required/wanted subjects only a few will even attempt to write something. If you want an audience that sends in articles, you at least should provide some hints on the preferred subjects. (my 2 cts).

The new thread that I made is over [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/38095-Kerbin-Geographic-Institute).

**Edited <time datetime="2013-06-28T14:53:40Z" title="06/28/2013 02:53  PM" data-short="11 yr">June 28, 2013</time> by Bioman222**
The KGSS isn't dead, as its core goal is still alive and well. That is the desire to enrich the scientific content of the KSP.

I am Making A Revival Of this just because it looks so cool.

I will make a new thread and give credit to you.

EDIT: Well I guess I could just send you over the PDFs.

**Edited <time datetime="2013-07-24T03:02:21Z" title="07/24/2013 03:02  AM" data-short="10 yr">July 24, 2013</time> by Nfeld The Rocketeer**
PDF - as in - you have a journal, magazine or article? Send me a PM.

A proposal:

Several people have engaged in voyages of discovery on Kerbin without planes or spacecraft. There was a charity journey by land to the north pole, and two (soon to be three) people have circumnavigated the planet with boats. I'm sure there have been other heroic journeys that I'm not aware of.

I propose that a number of terrain features be named after the forum members that have engaged in these endeavors. Having said that:

![4KGSS.png](https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-a7WjDoaxxGk/UjlRHjS88QI/AAAAAAAAGBs/ZLDQ2eGWLDQ/s800/4KGSS.png)

The following proposed names have to do with this thread: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25016-In-search-of-Ferdinand-Magellan/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25016-In-search-of-Ferdinand-Magellan/)

Point of Thersis: The forum member Thersis crashed their naval ship after travelling 534km of KSP. This point is roughly that distance.

William's Point: William Kerbin was the pilot of the second naval vessel to circumnavigate Kerbin.

Isthmus of Kamm: The forum member Kerbies\_are\_my\_Minions (KAMM) was the first to circumnavigate Kerbin by boat as far as I know. He would have been the first to cross this isthmus to do so.

Strait of Zakku: the forum member Ekku Zakku was the second person to circumnavigate Kerbin.

Russell's reef: I noticed this area as I was attempting the 3rd circumnavigation. Named after one of Kerbies\_are\_my\_minions' crew, Russel Kerbin

Kai's reef: I noticed this area as I was attempting the 3rd circumnavigation. Named after one of Kerbies\_are\_my\_minions' crew, Kai Kerbin

Inattention Island: I nearly plowed full speed into this island when I got distracted and wasn't watching my boat.

So, in closing and summary, I propose the KGSS honor these and other ground and water based explorers.
I already have a revive made in the ISSO

> I already have a revive made in the ISSO

Ok. Please see above.

Does this society still exist/work? Or something else like it?

I need some "official" help at naming features around Kerbin City =)
